lead_paragraph: Global death rates related to pregnancies fell by more than a third from 2000 to 2015. But the United States has gone against the grain, new data show.

headline.print_headline: Maternal Mortality Rate in U.S. Rises, Defying Global Trend, Study Finds
headline.main: Maternal Mortality Rate in U.S. Rises, Defying Global Trend, Study Finds

snippet: Global death rates related to pregnancies fell by more than a third from 2000 to 2015. But the United States has gone against the grain, new data show....
abstract: Study by Institute of Health Metrics and Evaluation reports maternal mortality rate in America has risen, bucking global trend where rates have fallen by as much as third; researchers propose increases in obesity and diabetes are responsible.
